io.iron.ironmq

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.iron.ironmq.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    The Client class provides access to the IronMQ service.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

      This constructor is equivalent to Client(null, null, null).

      Client(java.lang.String projectId, java.lang.String token, Cloud cloud)
      Constructs a new Client using the specified project ID and token.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        This constructor is equivalent to Client(null, null, null).

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String projectId,
      java.lang.String token)
        This constructor is equivalent to Client(projectId, token, null).
        Parameters:
        projectId - A 24-character project ID.
        token - An OAuth token.

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String projectId,
      java.lang.String token,
      Cloud cloud)
        Constructs a new Client using the specified project ID and token. A null projectId, token, or cloud will be filled in using the filesystem and environment for configuration as described here. The network is not accessed during construction and this call succeeds even if the credentials are invalid.
        Parameters:
        projectId - A 24-character project ID.
        token - An OAuth token.
        cloud - The cloud to use.

    • Method Detail

      • queue

        public Queue queue(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a Queue using the given name. The network is not accessed during this call.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Queue to create.
